verses.text: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet upon Shigionoth.
O LORD, I have heard thy speech, \add and\add* was afraid: O LORD, revive thy work in the midst of the years, in the midst of the years make known; in wrath remember mercy.
God came from Teman, and the Holy One from mount Paran. Selah. His glory covered the heavens, and the earth was full of his praise.
And \add his\add* brightness was as the light; he had horns \add coming\add* out of his hand; and there \add was\add* the hiding of his power.
Before him went the pestilence, and burning coals went forth at his feet.
He stood, and measured the earth: he beheld, and drove asunder the nations; and the everlasting mountains were scattered, the perpetual hills did bow: his ways \add are\add* everlasting.
I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction: \add and\add* the curtains of the land of Midian trembled.

Was the LORD displeased against the rivers? \add was\add* thy anger against the rivers? \add was\add* thy wrath against the sea, that thou didst ride upon thy horses, \add and\add* thy chariots of salvation?
Thy bow was made quite naked, \add according\add* to the oaths of the tribes, \add even thy\add* word. Selah. Thou didst cleave the earth with rivers.
The mountains saw thee, \add and\add* they trembled: the overflowing of the water passed by: the deep uttered his voice, \add and\add* lifted up his hands on high.
The sun \add and\add* moon stood still in their habitation: at the light of thy arrows they went, \add and\add* at the shining of thy glittering spear.
Thou didst march through the land in indignation, thou didst thresh the heathen in anger.

Thou wentest forth for the salvation of thy people, \add even\add* for salvation with thy anointed; thou woundedst the head out of the house of the wicked, by uncovering the foundation to the neck. Selah.
Thou didst strike through with his staffs the head of his villages: they came out as a whirlwind to scatter me: their rejoicing \add was\add* as to devour the poor secretly.
Thou didst walk through the sea with thy horses, \add through\add* the mire of great waters.

When I heard, my belly trembled; my lips quivered at the voice: rottenness entered into my bones, and I trembled in myself, that I might rest in the day of trouble: when he cometh up to the people, he will invade them with his troops.

Although the fig-tree shall not blossom, neither \add shall\add* fruit \add be\add* in the vines; the labor of the olive shall fail, and the fields shall yield no food; the flock shall be cut off from the fold, and \add there shall be\add* no herd in the stalls:
Yet I will rejoice in the LORD, I will joy in the God of my salvation.
The Lord GOD \add is\add* my strength, and he will make my feet like hinds' \add feet\add* , and he will make me to walk upon my high places. To the chief singer on my stringed instruments.
